6:["$","section",null,{"className":"py-16","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container mx-auto px-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-3xl mx-auto","children":[["$","h2",null,{"className":"text-3xl font-bold mb-6","children":["About ","Entre Ríos"]}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground text-lg leading-relaxed","children":"Entre Ríos lives up to its name — nestled between the Paraná and Uruguay rivers, the province is defined by water. The thermal hot springs circuit (Federación, Colón, Gualeguaychú) has made it a domestic tourism powerhouse, with natural hot springs resorts dotting the landscape. The riverside towns offer a gentler pace of life, with fishing, swimming, and asados by the water being the primary pastimes. Gualeguaychú hosts Argentina's biggest carnival — a feathered, sequined spectacle that rivals Rio. The capital Paraná sits on a bluff overlooking the Paraná River and offers a compact, livable city with colonial architecture and a strong sense of community. For expats, Entre Ríos offers extraordinarily affordable living in a peaceful, water-blessed landscape."}]]}]}]}]
